cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi (70 km) NW of Cabo San Lucas, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest along the Baja California peninsula through Saturday, then turning northwest and weakening over the Pacific well south-southwest of southern California

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baja California peninsula north of Punta Eugenia to San Juan De Las Palomas; mainland Mexico north of Bahia Kino to Puerto Libertad
weather_observation.warning_coast: Baja California peninsula from Punta Eugenia to Bahia San Juan Bautista; mainland Mexico from Bahia Tempehuaya to Bahia Kino
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and western Mexico, entire Baja California peninsula; moisture may extend into southern California, southern Nevada, and SW Arizona
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to windy conditions possible late Sunday into Monday with gusts 25â€“30 mph, below tropical-storm force
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Lidia could produce periods of heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms, with localized urban flooding possible but totals generally below 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and dangerous rip currents along Southern California beaches late weekend into early next week
